metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5805 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
A boundary error within the "quicktake_100_load_raw()" function (internal/dcraw_common.cpp) in LibRaw versions prior to 0.18.8 can be exploited to cause a stack-based buffer overflow and subsequently cause a crash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5805` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.18.11-1
libraw20 - 0.18.11-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> Fixed in trusty / xenial via debian/patches/security_0.18.8_2.patch

criterions.comment: darktable package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
dcraw package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
exactimage package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
kodi package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
libraw package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.18.11-1').
rawtherapee package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
